episode.content: Actor Kataoka Ainosuke explores "The Battles of Coxinga" by Chikamatsu Monzaemon. It's an epic tale with a Sino-Japanese hero taking up arms in China for the family his father once served.
episode.description: Actor Kataoka Ainosuke explores "The Battles of Coxinga" by Chikamatsu Monzaemon. It's an epic tale with a Sino-Japanese hero taking up arms in China for the family his father once served.
episode.subtitle: The Battles of Coxinga
episode.title: KABUKI KOOL

episode.content: Kabuki is full of music played both on and off stage. Actor Kataoka Ainosuke and musician Kawase Roshu guide us through the beautiful complexities of Sankyoku.
episode.description: Kabuki is full of music played both on and off stage. Actor Kataoka Ainosuke and musician Kawase Roshu guide us through the beautiful complexities of sankyoku.
episode.subtitle: Sankyoku: Kabuki Chamber Music
episode.title: KABUKI KOOL

episode.content: Kabuki dance started as a showpiece for a female character, but then dances for male characters appeared - dances daring, comical and acrobatic!
episode.description: Kabuki dance started as a showpiece for a female character, but then dances for male characters appeared - dances daring, comical, and acrobatic!
episode.subtitle: Kabuki Dance for Tachiyaku Male Roles
episode.title: KABUKI KOOL

episode.content: Eirakukan is a historic theater in Hyogo Prefecture. Actor Kataoka Ainosuke explains how traditional seating and a small capacity create an extraordinary and intimate atmosphere.
episode.description: Eirakukan is a historic theater in Hyogo Prefecture. Actor Kataoka Ainosuke explains how traditional seating and a small capacity create an extraordinary and intimate atmosphere.
episode.subtitle: Kabuki at Eirakukan
episode.title: KABUKI KOOL

episode.content: Ishikawa Goemon is a legendary thief from the late 16th century who appears in several kabuki plays. Actor Kataoka Ainosuke explores what makes this figure so popular.
episode.description: Ishikawa Goemon is a legendary thief from the late 16th century who appears in several kabuki plays. Actor Kataoka Ainosuke explores what makes this figure so popular.
episode.subtitle: The Super Thief Ishikawa Goemon
episode.title: KABUKI KOOL

episode.content: The historic figure of Minamoto no Yoshitsune has been immortalized in many kabuki plays as a child, a skilled warrior and a tragic hero. Explore with actor Kataoka Ainosuke.
episode.description: The historic figure of Minamoto no Yoshitsune has been immortalized in many kabuki plays as a child, a skilled warrior and a tragic hero. Explore with actor Kataoka Ainosuke.
episode.subtitle: Tragic Hero Yoshitsune
episode.title: KABUKI KOOL

episode.content: Actor Kataoka Ainosuke explores the fantastic play, "The Dance of the Earth Spider," where one actor skillfully switches between 5 very different roles.
episode.description: Actor Kataoka Ainosuke explores the fantastic play, "The Dance of the Earth Spider," where one actor skillfully switches between 5 very different roles.
episode.subtitle: Kabuki Dance: Henge Buyo
episode.title: KABUKI KOOL

episode.content: A historic fight between sumo wrestlers and the Megumi firefighting gang is dramatized in this play, which ends in a free-for-all on stage. Kabuki actor Kataoka Ainosuke is our guide. The firemen on the left, headed by their leader Tatsugoro confront the sumo wrestlers on the right, headed by their leader, champion wrestler Yotsuguruma.
episode.description: A historic fight between sumo wrestlers and the Megumi firefighting gang is dramatized in this play, which ends in a free-for-all on stage. Kabuki actor Kataoka Ainosuke is our guide.
episode.subtitle: The Fight of the Megumi Firemen and Sumo Wrestlers
episode.title: KABUKI KOOL

episode.content: Scarface Yosaburo is one of the most famous plays of late Edo period kabuki. It's a romance between a young and beautiful couple, with shocking twists that showcases Edo style. A chance encounter between the son of a wealthy family and the beautiful mistress of a gang boss transforms their lives forever.
episode.description: Scarface Yosaburo is one of the most famous plays of late Edo period kabuki. It's a romance between a young and beautiful couple, with shocking twists that showcases Edo style.
episode.subtitle: Stylish Kabuki Melodrama: "Scarface Yosaburo"
episode.title: KABUKI KOOL

episode.content: A family tragedy when in a civil war, 2 brothers, both brilliant strategists, fight on opposing sides. Moritsuna worries about his younger brother, culminating in having to identify his brother's head. The tense scene when Moritsuna must examine his brother's head.
episode.description: This is a family tragedy during a civil war where two brothers fight on opposing sides, both brilliant strategists. The story takes place against the real historical background.
episode.subtitle: Moritsuna's Battle Camp
episode.title: KABUKI KOOL

episode.content: As with live performance worldwide, COVID-19 has affected kabuki. Actors Kataoka Ainosuke and Nakamura Kazutaro talk about the difficulties and reveal some creative solutions. In the first performance after Kabukiza reopened, the fierce lions dance as if to drive away COVID-19.
episode.description: As with live performance worldwide, COVID-19 has affected kabuki. Actors Kataoka Ainosuke and Nakamura Kazutaro talk about the difficulties and reveal some creative solutions.
episode.subtitle: Kabuki and the Pandemic
episode.title: KABUKI KOOL

episode.content: Kabuki often depicts traditional Japanese dishes. Actor Kataoka Ainosuke introduces scenes with several examples, and teaches us about what foods were popular in the Edo period. In "Hokaibo," a disreputable begging priest takes time off from abducting a beautiful girl for a bowl of soba noodles from a roadside stall.
episode.description: Kabuki often depicts traditional Japanese dishes. Actor Kataoka Ainosuke introduces scenes with several examples, and teaches us about what foods were popular in the Edo period.
episode.subtitle: Edo Food in Kabuki
episode.title: KABUKI KOOL
